plptool.mods

Class IORegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • plptool.mods.IORegistry

  • public class IORegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    This class associates a module to its display frame, and allows users to dynamically load / remove modules during runtime. Module developers need to add module information and initialization here.
    See Also:
    PLPSimBus, PLPSimBusModule, plp.PLPIORegistry

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IORegistry(ProjectDriver plp)
      IORegistry constructor populates the module information array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IORegistry

        public IORegistry(ProjectDriver plp)
        IORegistry constructor populates the module information array. Module developers will have to add their module's information here to be listed in the PLPTool I/O window.

    • Method Detail

      • attachModuleToBus

        public int attachModuleToBus(int index,
                             long addr,
                             long size)
        Instantiate and attach a PLPSimBusModule-based module to this I/O registry and to the bus of the given simulation core. This method also associates a module with its internal frame, if GUI representation is implemented. Module developers will have to write their module's initialization here.
        Parameters:
        index - Module type as registered in the constructor.
        addr - The starting address of the module's address space.
        size - The size of the module's address space.
        Returns:
        PLP_OK on completion, or PLP_SIM_INVALID_MODULE if invalid index is specified.

      • attachDynamicModule

        public int attachDynamicModule(int index,
                               long startAddr,
                               long endAddr,
                               boolean isWordAligned,
                               java.lang.Object frame)
        Instantiate and attach a dynamic PLPSimBusModule-based module to this I/O registry and to the bus of the given simulation core. PLPDynamicModuleFramework is called to create a new instance of the module.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the dynamic module CLASS
        addr - Starting address of the module's memory map
        size - Number of registers
        isWordAligned - Denote whether the module's address space is word aligned
        frame - Frame object associated with this module
        Returns:
        PLP_OK on completion, or PLP_DBUSMOD_INSTANTIATION_ERROR if the module object failed to initialize

      • getNumOfModsAttached

        public int getNumOfModsAttached()
        Returns:
        The number of modules attached to this registry.

      • getNumOfMods

        public int getNumOfMods()
        Returns:
        The number of modules defined in the registry.

        public PLPSimBusModule getModule(int index)
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public int getPositionInBus(int index)
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:
        The type of the module

      • removeAllModules

        public void removeAllModules()
        Removes all modules attached to this registry AND removes them from the simulation bus, effectively destroying all modules that were attached to the simulation.
        Parameters:
        sim - Simulation core that is being run.

      • removeModule

        public int removeModule(int index)
        Removes the specified module from the registry AND the simulation bus.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the module to be removed.
        sim - Simulation core that is being run.

      • stopThreadedMods

        public void stopThreadedMods()
        Stop module threads

      • gui_eval

        public void gui_eval()
        Execute a GUI evaluation on all modules attached to this registry.

      • getAvailableModulesInformation

        public java.lang.Object[][] getAvailableModulesInformation()
        Returns:
        Module information in an object array. Used by the I/O window of the main app to list available modules that are in this registry.

      • getAttachedModules

        public java.lang.Object[] getAttachedModules()
        Returns:
        All modules attached to this registry as an object array.
